JobFullDesc: Nestlé Coffee Partners is on a mission to transform how consumers experience coffee. With iconic brands like Starbucks, Nescafe, Chameleon, Teavana, and Blue Bottle, our diverse and delicious product portfolio is brimming with rich and fulfilling opportunities. Our new office, located in the heart of Seattle, provides an inspiring and high-energy work environment that fuels our creative pioneering of the coffee market. Together, we can brew remarkable things for customers across the globe.POSITION SUMMARYThis Senior Specialist role for Nestlé Coffee Partners will be responsible for the data and analytics supporting end-to-end supply chain including supply planning, demand planning, customer facing & procurement.  This will be accomplished through standardizing and streamlining data sources, utilizing data preparation and transformation tools including Power BI and Excel Power Query, automation bots and tools and a variety of data sources.  The role will provide support for existing data visualizations and tools as well as develop new reporting and tools with collaborations throughout the NCP and NUSA supply chain to ensure supply and drive efficiency in day-to-day processes and metric reporting.SUMMARY OF KEY RESPONSIBILITIESResponsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: •  Utilizes enterprise systems and tools to analyze operational performance and prepare ad hoc analyses and data visualizations in Power BI, Excel and other tools to drive improved business decision making •  Serves as supply chain resource for data automation via SAP/APO/BW extracts, robotic process automation (RPA) and integrating other existing data sources.•  Develops and enhances processes for effective supply planning, deployment, demand planning & customer reporting. Identifies cost and benefit of potential improvements and manages the implementation of improvements. •  Develops business requirements to drive optimal operations performance through systems, planning, commercialization, customer service and distribution practices through the development of reports, scorecards, visualizations, analysis or other tools. •  Represents business unit data, operations, and customer requirements within the enterprise. Leads cross functional teams to resolve data and process issues. •  Serves as the key point of contact with NUSA Supply Chain analytics team.•  Provide support for new system rollouts and integrations (e.g. Connected Planning @ Nestlé). SUMMARY OF EXPERIENCE:•  Minimum 5 years’ experience of performing analytics and problem-solving in a fast paced environment •  Minimum 5 years’ experience with performance metrics development and root cause analysis •  Minimum 5 years’ experience conducting data collection, reporting, and analysis •  Minimum 5 years’ experience in data automation and visualization tools The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.
